Sentencas: Development of highly reliable solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) is strongly requested, and the introduction of a self-protecting function is an ideal approach to increase the reliability of SOFCs.
Titulo: Nickel-Iron Anode Substrate for Smart Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with a Self-Protecting Function Against Reoxidation

Sentencas: A highly porous (>33%) NiFe metal substrate, which has well-developed nanopores, is prepared by reduction of NiOFe2O3.
Titulo: Nickel-Iron Anode Substrate for Smart Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with a Self-Protecting Function Against Reoxidation

Sentencas: In an oxidizing atmosphere, a thin layer of Fe2O3 forms on the surface of the substrate.
Titulo: Nickel-Iron Anode Substrate for Smart Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with a Self-Protecting Function Against Reoxidation

Sentencas: As a result, the porous morphology changes at the surface and becomes denser.
Titulo: Nickel-Iron Anode Substrate for Smart Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with a Self-Protecting Function Against Reoxidation

Sentencas: This morphological change occurs only at the surface and prevents oxidation of Ni in the bulk of the substrate.
Titulo: Nickel-Iron Anode Substrate for Smart Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with a Self-Protecting Function Against Reoxidation

Sentencas: Furthermore, the surface morphology returns to its original state following reduction.
Titulo: Nickel-Iron Anode Substrate for Smart Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with a Self-Protecting Function Against Reoxidation

Sentencas: Therefore, despite the fact that Ni is readily oxidized, Ni metal phase is sustained in the NiFe bimetallic alloy substrate even after 480?h oxidation in air.
Titulo: Nickel-Iron Anode Substrate for Smart Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with a Self-Protecting Function Against Reoxidation

Sentencas: The cell power density is also stably sustained after a few reductionreoxidation cycles.
Titulo: Nickel-Iron Anode Substrate for Smart Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with a Self-Protecting Function Against Reoxidation

Sentencas: Here, we report that NiFe bimetal alloy substrate exhibits a self-protecting function against reoxidation of the substrate, which would otherwise lead to a permanent failure of the cell.
Titulo: Nickel-Iron Anode Substrate for Smart Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with a Self-Protecting Function Against Reoxidation
